Reviews.Title: “To clear things up!”
Reviews.Author: pikey1203
Reviews.Content: Ok Ive read several several reviews and am alittle disappointed in some of the reasons that people wouldnt stay here again. I actually live a few blocks away and stay here as an escape to the busy city life....For those who say the neighborhood is "rough" are probably little rich people who get scared of their own shadow, the homeless people outside are usually extremely drunk and can barely stand up half the time and if you give them a dollar they make sure no one messes with your car (i buy a six pack and let them share it) they watch my car.....the lobster/crab shack across the street has an opening next to it to go to a nice sitting area that you can see the river or you can go like a block away to the park which the whole thing sits on the river theres a bar/grill a few blocks down (finnegans on the river) very nice place to hang out when not at the inn. i agree the breakfast sucks but HELLO YOUR IN MIAMI great food everywhere! the people who cant look past the "cats" and extremely old building should have just spent the money the obviously have instead of trying to be cheap and then crying that the place isnt what the expected!

Reviews.Title: “Cats and Fleas”
Reviews.Author: Lagniappe-37
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in the evening and were ready for a good night sleep. Unfortunately, when we got to our room and sat down we were attacked by fleas, not just one or two but a bunch. We did manage to get moved to another room in another building and only killed a few fleas - probably on our clothes from that first room. This place is dirty, carpets stained, crud on the floors and corners in the bathroom, light bulbs missing from the lamps and cracked walls and ceilings, not to mention the traffic from the elevated bridge right outside our window - 15 feet... Breakfast left a lot to be desired - generic yogurt, rcie crispies and corn flakes, big bowl of grape jelly, no jam, marmalade, etc. Got to say that the home made nut bread was pretty good. Cats were everywhere - rubbing all over us when we were outside eating breakfast. Bottom line, we got what we paid for. We should have paid an additional $10 for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great B&B away from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for somewhere different away from South Beach and like funky vintage then this is a great place to stay. It's helpful if you have a navigation system as it's a little tough to find at night. Old fashioned charm and a real historic group of buildings which is very rare these days. Beautiful grounds in a compound which is safe as you are near a very poor neighborhood. Never had a problem over the several years I've stayed there. Why pay $300 a night when you can stay in Miami for half that.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the middle of the city!”
Reviews.Author: miacapretta
Reviews.Content: After the crowds, traffic, and noise around Miami, the Miami River Inn was a wonderful surprise! Set into a lively neighborhood and close to the Miami River, with a park nearby and some very good restaurants within walking distance, the Inn is a quiet oasis of older, well kept buildings surrounding a lush tropical garden. We found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful, our rooms were well appointed, comfortable, and clean, the kids loved chasing lizards around the grounds, and the cats reminded us of Hemingway's Key West. Though full, as evidenced by the number of guests (from around the US and the world!) that we met either at the lovely breakfast served in the garden or later in the day during our daily swim in the pool, we felt as if we had the place to ourselves. Thanks to the staff for their recommendations, as the eating establishments and activities suggested only added to our visit. Walking over the drawer bridge and traveling on the "people-mover" (worth the ride just for the sights, particularly the lights of the city at night) added to our fun and we would have missed both (and a few great meals) without their suggestions. We will definately visit again.... we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: GlennBomke
Reviews.Content: I MUST write this after reading Some of the other peoples reviews. We just finished three days at the Inn, in summary, Exactly what I expected, Exactly what I needed, Exactly what I'd do again and again. So the furniture is an older style, the bed had a little sag in the middle, WE like it that way (just like home). The bathroom was remodeled in 1960 something, it worked, was clean and an Incredible view of the 1st street draw bridge action. It was Perfect that we locked our car in a gated lot for every day we were there.We walked into downtown every moment we could over a drawbridge that entertained the heck out of us, We ate, Drank and were very Merry all on foot from that Inn. We rode metromover, 4 blocks from the Inn, to every part of the city. We walked to and fro from the Inn through every neighborhood, feeling very comfortable. Within 10 blocks of this Inn, IS, everything you can do in Miami to entertain yourself, be entertained and eat like no where else, anywhere. Very rarely am I this entertained staying in a white box with a balcony. Our stay at this location WILL be repeated, again. Great Time

Reviews.Title: “Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: R J
Reviews.Content: I just finished a work trip staying at the Inn for a week. The Inn has been operating as an Inn since the beginning of Miami, over a 100 years ago and in a sense, it shows. What I mean is that it is an old wood building furnished with antiques, and with all the usual quirky issues of a National Register historic property. I found a couple small places that need touch-up paint, but overall the buildings are in better shape than many of the chains I've stayed in for twice as much. My room was clean and comfy. My TV was tiny but I didn't visit Miami to watch television; it did suffice to catch up on the weather and the free wi-fi worked well. My shower was hot, and the AC was cold. The pool was very nice, as was the garden and veranda by the breakfast nook, which served homemade nut bread with coffee and fruit and yogurt. The neighborhood is a working family neighborhood with joggers, fishermen, kids going to school, etc., and several parks within walking distance, but not dangerous by any measure; check with staff about parking options. Also w/in walking distance (5 min) was Jamon Jamon Jamon, a wonderful tapas bar and restaurant (best anchovies I've ever had!). There is a sports bar/tropical bar on the river with a beautiful view of downtown reflecting on the water. Across the street is a working waterfront for lobster and stone crab, which you can get fresh at Garcia's restaurant over the bridge. The helpful staff arranged a cab for early in the morning and it took us 15 min to get to the airport. If you want a great location, want great staff, want something pretty and unique, this is it. My nicest visit to Miami so far.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations and Appreciation”
Reviews.Author: travelenthusiast070
Reviews.Content: This review follows the last of three or four visits my wife and I spent at the Miami River Inn since the mid-1990s. It is inspired by a few recent reviews which reveal unrealistic expectations and failure to appreciate what the Inn has to offer. Instead of one reviewer's "quaint country inn", one finds a fenced, gated compound at the southwest corner of the intersection where the Flagler drawbridge crosses the Miami River. Across the river are downtown skyscrapers, across the road are a seafood operation, a park and a playground, while Little Havana lies to the south and west. The compound includes an off-street parking area, a courtyard with swimming pool, and four clapboard two-storey buildings built in 1906 with porches, living rooms, and 38 guestrooms with private baths. It is ringed by tall palm trees, guarded by a resident group of ten or twelve cats, carries an historic designation, and is within walking distance of local and downtown restaurants. It is also a relatively quiet and peaceful spot in an otherwise bustling urban setting. Beside peace and quiet, we find that the Inn's location provides ready access to Miami's highway network and that those who man the front desk ... Jane, Carlos, and Metris... are friendly and sufficiently knowledgeable to provide good directions and direct guests to worthwhile restaurants. Also, this is not a place with paper-thin walls and noisy, incponsiderate neighbors. (For those who may be disturbed by outside noise, I suggest that you choose a south or west-facing room). Finally, room rates are relatively low. Guests will therefore get value for money, which is all too rare in big cities.

Reviews.Title: “Gave it a shot”
Reviews.Author: Deenie0917
Reviews.Content: I read several reviews before booking and gave this place a try to be away from the fancy miami hotels. We thought a quaint country Inn would be fun and have character. First of all the area is not to safe , we saw glass from smashed in car windows, so do yourself a favour and pay to park in there gated lot. Second of all the outside is very run down, the "E" in the name is falling off, the paint all chipped and needs repairs done. The outside furniture is dirty and mouldy. Inside it has charm when you first walk in, it has that old inn musky smell which gave it character. The room was small and we felt like we were in a cute doll house. The view was of another building and the fire escape. The tv was a 9-10 Inch and had no remote and very limited stations. Our bathroom was dirty, hair from the previous person was around the tolet base and the sink. 30 minutes after we arrived there were over a dozen ants (large red one) all over the bathroom and came into the bedroom. there was some kind of dead fly/ant shells and dirty on the spare toilet roll. There was no hair dryer in the room. The next morning we got up and a huge cockroach was walking around on our sink. We walked around. the property and it was very rundown and nothing at all like the pictures. The view of the river was hidden by a lobster ship yard. When checking out the front desk did not apologize for the ants or roach just said he would check it out. We took photos to prove we were picky We will not stay here again nor would we suggest it to friends

Reviews.Title: “Only B&B in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Lauren K
Reviews.Content: Upon my second visit I realized this is my fav staycation place. Nestled by the Miami River and featured in the movie "Marley and Me" it is a hidden gem. Gated among the banyan trees there are several buildings circling the property. The staff is helpful and kind. Huge swimming pool and yard in the middle. Very economical and able to park car safely while cruising out of the Port of Miami. Also, on the National Historic Register. Check it out on your next trip to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “One word..... HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: Cece_24
Reviews.Content: I went to the Miami River Inn to stay Friday thru Sunday. When I first went there I thought that Expedia made a mistake. I arrived at about 9:50pm. The neighborhood was dark and scary. The place has a black gate around the hotel. I felt like I had to keep looking over my shoulder for fear that someone would mug me on my way to the black gate. You can't just walk in either. You have to ring the bell which is located on the left side. As you go up the steps you see skinny cats and there about 3 or 4 of them. There was trash on the inside of the gate around the back. The place looks old and it smells like old furniture that's been sitting in storage. It's very stuffy in there and dusty. I felt trapped like I couldn't breath. The guy shows me to my room which is located in another building. The furniture is out dated, the quilts had stains on it, and the bed is uncomfortable. There were little ants all on my sink, the shower was absolutely disgusting and there were dead ants in the corner of the shower. There was a dead bug under my bed. I refused to lay in the bed for fear of bed bugs. The TV was old and dusty and there was no remote. I went back to the front desk to see if I could change rooms and no one was there. There was a sign that read if I needed assistance to call 320 which I did numerous times and I got no answer. When I wanted to leave I couldn't because my car was locked in the gate and once again no one was there to let me out. I wound up staying with a friend that night and the next day I went to check out even though I paid $227.78 for 2 days. I explained to the guy that the hotel was unsatisfactory and also tried to explain why. He acted as if he didn't care about what I had to say, got nasty with me, and cursed me. When I demanded that I speak to his manager he said he wasn't there and that I could reach him through email only. I called expedia and complained of the nastiness at the hotel and how the staff were very rude. Do yourself a favor don't waste your money here. You'll be sorry you did.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Miami”
Reviews.Author: Olivia J
Reviews.Content: So when you go to Miami you expect art deco hotels (probably a little over priced), places like the Delano and then a few hostels scattered about. Miami River Inn is a little touch of something else. Its more like a Bed and Breakfast/Guest House in many ways. Its a small collection of large historic houses all on the same grounds. Coupled with the amazing weather in Miami, it gives a colonial/tropical feel. Each room is individual and kitted out in a kitch fashion, an earlier time period than art deco. Its large enough that they have room for a good few guests but small enough that that it still keeps that personal touch. A brilliant example is this is when we arrived we were greeted by the owner and Norman the dog (cute 8 year old). She had time to shoot the breeze with us whilst I rubbed Norman's belly. I hadn't read up on it before hand but its a 'green' hotel which I was also impressed with as so much in Miami is about excess. Before you ask, no it doesn't mean dirty sheets or baths, it just means being conscientiousness as a hotel in some of their choices. And this relaxed, well meaning attitude resonates through out the hotel. Its like going round to your favourite aunt's house. A warm and caring reception. I don't want to give the wrong impression here, they do the things I feel are necessary in a hotel these days. They are organised, clean, have wi fi, AC, private parking, pool... but they do what the bigger (and even some of the smaller chains) Hotels forget/miss out on and that's personalty and real care. Wish we'd come across this place sooner. My friends and I loved it. Its not the Ritz and I'm glad of it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: supercat097
Reviews.Content: My daughter-in-law booked this B&B because we needed a place we could park a boat trailer and she likes B&Bs. They arrived early in the day but we arrived late at night only to see a bunch of homeless people sleeping on the sidewalks less than 2 blocks away. The property has a high fence around it but is in a sketchy area. The grounds were nice and tropical and I didn't mind the cats at all, but we heard scratching and squeaking in the ceiling two nights in a row (rats most likely) so we told the front desk and they moved us to another building and a lower floor. They did discount our bill because of the rat problem but I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: LMPM
Reviews.Content: The Miami River Inn was not at all what we expected. According the the hotel's website, the hotel appeared charming, clean, and comfortable. Upon arrival, we were disappointed that the surrounding area had us feeling unsafe and uncomfortable. The entire premise was unkept and dirty in appearance. There are some people who appear to live permanently on the property. There were many, many cats roaming all around the property. Our room was not very nice at all. It was not like the rooms that were pictured on the website. The shower was dirty with someone's long hairs in the bottom of it! There was central air that could not be controlled from our room. The room felt so dirty. The pillows were so old and had brown stained spots on them. The bed was so uncomfortable. We had to ask for an iron, ironboard, hair dryer, and extra rolls of toilet paper from the front desk since they were not automatically located in the room. There was no coffeemaker. Since it was a Bed & Breakfast, breakfast was included which consisted of breads, juices, yogurt, etc. (with gnats flying around the food). Not a hot breakfast as we had expected. One of the part-owners was not friendly to us at all and seemed to be bothered by our staying there. We have stayed at many hotels varying in price and quality. If this hotel had been clean and in a good neighborhood, we would have been satisfied for the price we paid. Overall, our experience at the Miami River Inn was uncomfortable and had us feeling unsafe in the surrounding neighborhood. We would not recommend others to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Charming Old Florida”
Reviews.Author: Joey2x
Reviews.Content: The Miami River Inn is the best value in Miami, especially if you enjoy its particular graces. It is a laid back tropical bed & breakfast with a Margaritaville casualness and beauty. Breakfast is very simple but the coffee is good and the milk and juice fresh. We enjoyed in the lush outside patio. Old Florida style. Just over the river but therefore totally away from the commercial hubbub. It is still extremely convenient to Downtown and only blocks from some excellent affordable Miami restaurants like Perricone and My Name Is Delores But You Can Call Me Lolita. The Inn property commands a large part of a block in a simple, well kept residential neighborhood. There is some traffic rumble from the bridge and the warnings that sound when the bridge is about to be raised. The whole property of the hotel and its parking lot is enclosed by a secure fence. As the staff is minimal, as with many a B&B, one has a key to the property as well as to oneâ€™s cabana and room. Management and maintenance staff are on hand during the working day. You may believe the good things said by others in their reviews. You might find the beds less than luxurious but they are clean and the rooms are ample and larger than much higher priced rooms in Miami. Wonderful for couples and families.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place but you gotta love history to really appreciate the place”
Reviews.Author: Clarie15
Reviews.Content: There is some truth to the bad reviews from other people. But I'll also agree with the good reviews. Pros: Great, quiet place. I love the history of the place. There are a lot of great little places to dine around the inn. Decent view of the city. The rooms were very clean and pretty spacious. There was a nice little sitting area inside the room that I liked to sit with my 2 year old son. The pool was nice and clean. Outside, back area was spacious and nice place to sit, read, and relax. A park within walking distance where we took our son to play. We all loved it! Cons: The bed and breakfast part...not so great. Any slight movement made the bed creak. The pillows and bed were a bit uncomfortable. (I felt I was sleeping over my grandparents' house. LOL!) The breakfast was unappetizing. I ate anything that was closed (bananas, cereal, yogurt) I would recommend this place to people that appreciate quaint, quiet, antique locations. You want to just relax and not deal with the usual Miami nightlife, this is definitely the place to go. You can go have a drink at a local bar (Tobacco Road) but it won't be the madness of Miami Beach.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Jewel”
Reviews.Author: Stonesdoor
Reviews.Content: My husband said to say, "Don't be put off by the neighborhood, discover the jewel in the heart of Miami." It is completely secure; even the car is locked in. Moderately priced B&B that was all we hoped for when planning a little getaway mid-week. Charming! We relaxed in our room, went to dinner at nearby Garcia's Seafood, slept well. There's a lovely park across the street from the Inn. A little breakfast of cold cereal, yogurt, applesauce nut bread, and great coffee was had in a sweet little breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Charming piece of Old Florida”
Reviews.Author: footloose20
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed in the Miami River Inn. I read some of the recent comments and thought it must have gone down in quality. As it turned out, we found it to be just as charming as the first time. We got a good deal on Expedia. Our room was very pretty and clean The bed was perfectly comfortable, and the room we had, #11, was if anything nicer than the room we had the first time. We thought the breakfast was adequate, very similar to breakfasts in other B&Bs that we have stayed in, and we enjoyed eating out in the garden. I think that anyone who is offended by Spanish speaking people would be better off staying in white-bread America where they belong. Some people that, especially off of cruise ships, seem to be more used to the Holiday Inn type of setting. If this is the case, why not stay in those establishments ? There are enough of them around. Leave places like the Miami River Inn to people who appreciate them.

Reviews.Title: “Mayday Mayday”
Reviews.Author: EarthIsWonderful
Reviews.Content: Uniformly bad and dangerous service. After calling twice en route from delayed planes to warn of late arrival, my colleague arrived to a closed office and was forced to take a cab to another hotel to spend the night. No one bothered to tell her that the Miami River Inn is UNSTAFFED after 11pm. Another female colleague complained FOUR TIMES that her hall light was out and she felt unsafe walking up the three floors to a dark hallway and fumbling for her keys her room late at night. Nobody did anything about it. The breakfast (at this alleged B&B) centered on plain toast. Simple concern would have been appreciated. In this economy, stay at a place that shows its appreciation for guests...

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and wonderful hospitality”
Reviews.Author: miaminativeGeorgia
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Miami River Inn twice, and booked my son and daughter-in-law there for their honeymoon. Both times I enjoyed myself immensely and my son and his bride had a wonderful time. The reason was the hospitality extended by the manager and the desk clerk. They were very accommodating - even serving me wine when I came in for the night. I enjoyed their conversations and their helpfulness. I always found the rooms comfortable and clean. The breakfast could be a little better; especially if they would have a hostess to serve more ethnic and tantalizing casseroles. Other B&B's have a family style breakfast. I would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jmo_traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a bit long & detailed.....but you should be informed before booking here. I booked 4 nights here. At the very least....you would hope that the 2 things a 'bed' & 'breakfast' would make sure to do, is to ensure that the 'bed' & 'breakfast' are top notch. The bed in our room was beyond unacceptable-we could feel the broken springs in the mattress along with a very obvious hump in the middle of the bed - clearly not replaced (maybe ever) very uncomfortable. The pillows on the bed were so TERRIBLE-one was soooo flat you could roll it up into a tight roll - been there for way too long maybe - eewww! There were 3 of us in our room & they only left 2 old towels (no washcloths at all) and the towels were FOUL! They left a horrible smell on our skin when drying off after bathing - disgusting! I called the front desk repeatedly and got nothing but the answering machine & never got a call back or response. (This was all the 1st day!) I thought we should try 1 more day just in case they had an 'off' day or something (my spouse was not of the same mind, but we tried it). Day 2 towels were JUST as gross! We had to dry off with hand towels, and still they only left 2 towels.....Again no response from front desk & no one even at the front desk when we went there! (both times it was in the evening around 9 pm but someone should have been attending!) No call back whatsoever. What if there was an emergency!!!???? Moving on to the breakfast....the little bldg that you go into was run down and not very clean inside, there were sugar ants all over the countertops & dirty dishes in the sink....the refrigerator handle in there was also very dirty, I personally look at those things for indications of cleanliness in a facility. The food was cold cereal (corn flakes/raisin bran?), yogurt, bananas, toast & bagles & coffee cake....I cannot eat dairy so, I couldn't eat anything much other than the coffee cake and sad to say, it had obviously been in the fridge for some length of time as the flavor had picked up the icky fridge air! One bite and I had to throw it away. There was, of course, no non-dairy creamer for the coffee. We had to go out to eat, both days. They should indicate that it's not a 'breakfast' but instead, just a continental. We could not do another night - we'd had enough. Our short vacation was being marred by the bad service & accomodations of this B&B. Whenever I travel I always check B&B's first - we are big fans and have stayed at many over the years! But this was was an absolute bust. I spoke with the owner of the Inn about all of these things upon checking out & was surprised that she did not even offer to compensate us for anything at all. Not very good business in my opinion. The antique furniture around was awesome & beautiful, but I thought the room textiles decor (bed & window treatments) was dated and did not even have that 'antique' feeling, just old. The grounds & gardens & even the buildings are so pleasant & pretty. It's ashame that the the accomodations and services are not tended to nearly as much as those other things. I cannot recommend this B&B to anyone. Such a shame.

Reviews.Title: “nice find”
Reviews.Author: daylate
Reviews.Content: We were traveling around South Florida recently with the thought of seeing Miami for one night. Little did we know there was a tennis tourament in town for the weekend plus a big concert. All major lodging was booked, but we had our travel guide book that listed the Miami River Inn. We had a hard time finding it because of some outdated info in the guide book. Once we did we had second thoughts, because of the location. It was are only choice for the night and it turned out to be very nice. The rooms were clean, the staff was great and the grounds around the buildings were nicely kept with a great pool. I'm not sure if they take families but it is very nice for couples or young adults. They serve a breakfast in the morning that is what you would get at a chain hotel. Only down side (for me) was there was no coffee maker in the room and nome served until 8:30 AM.

Reviews.Title: “Rough at night”
Reviews.Author: zoeybee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while attending the Winter Music Conference for two days. Everything was booked and this was the last place we could find for a reasonable price. The room was appointed with antiques as they say on the website, and fairly small, our friends stayed in a somewhat larger room across the building from us. All of us had the same complaint, the beds were very uncomfortable. It was hard to get information about the city from the front desk clerk. The bathroom was fairly clean. The pool and courtyard outside are absolutely delightful, private and plenty of seats in the shade. There are some great little restaurants nearby, mostly local Mom and Pop with Latino cuisine. A main hub of the metro station is a ten minute walk. Our friends couldn't get a cab to bring them back to the hotel late one night...the cab drivers told them they didn't go to that side of town. We ended up walking to the Bayfront several times and it really wasn't that bad, even at night. Still, I would not recommend going it alone. One night there were several bums sleeping outside the gate by our room... It was an interesting experience, but I wish we had stayed somewhere with better beds. Don't follow the advice of another reviewer who says it might be good if you aren't going to be there much, I was so exhausted from not getting good sleep, I missed out on some of the things I wanted to do while we were in town.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis with some rough edges”
Reviews.Author: markeo16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the inn in late March 2008. I read some of the other reviews and the place is a little tricky to find but not bad if you ask ahead of time or print out the directions from the website. The neighborhood is sort of rough but not really threatening in my opinion unless you want to walk around alone at night. There is some noise from the adjacent highway overpass but depending on the room not bad for an in-city hotel. Our room was upstairs in the main building. The first night the room smelled sort of musty and though there are windows they can't be opened. The second night the central AC was on and improved the smell a lot. The bed basically was shot but tolerable. The main asset of the place is historic character and the really nice shaded property, landscaped back yard, and breakfast. A movie with a scene about a quaint b&b was shot here a few days before we stayed - so that tells you something about the overall look of the place. The parking also is secure though the constant need for keys to get in and out does get a bit old. It is an easy drive from here to South Beach and there are some restaurants just across the river though we didn't go to those.

Reviews.Title: “not so good”
Reviews.Author: Indylady55
Reviews.Content: This B&B is very, very difficult to find, be sure to call and get directions. When we tried to call we only got a VM, which is one of the main problems with our stay. You could never find anyone at the front desk to check in/ check out, or ask any questions. When there was someone there they weren't particularly friendly. Now this place seems to have a very good reputation (It's in Lonely Planet) and was a very charming place to stay if you like B&B. The bathroom was questionably clean, found some brown sticky stuff on toilet tank lid. No plug for sink. This B&B is like an Oasis in a not really good area of Miami so you need a key to lock you car in the adjacent lot and a key to get into the fenced-in house, which brings us back to our arrival. There was no one at the front desk to answer phone calls or see us trying to get into the locked fence. Had this nice couple not come along and let us in, we would have had to find another place to stay. The breakfast was OK, coffee. juice, fruit basket, one small cut up coffee cake, yogurt, bagels, toast, etc. However, sitting outside the small kitchen in the courtyard area was glorious. It almost made up for a rather bad experience. I would not recommend this place to friends. but if you really like the B&B experience w/ all it's pitfalls, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful hotel near downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: DoberGo
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a two-night stay at the Miami River Inn and found it a quaint (if a bit quirky) B&B near downtown Miami on the edge of Little Havana. Pluses included the wonderfully decorated, meticulously clean, very large rooms, the nice garden and pool, a quiet setting, and a fine breakfast. Minuses would be the lack of a shower (just a bath) in our room , no maid service on Sunday and the rather ugly fence surrounding the grounds. Given the other reviews on this site, I wasn't sure what to expect of the neighborhood. The Inn is indeed on the edge of Little Havana, which we found to be a perfectly safe and quiet working-class neighborhood reflecting quite a few Latin cultures these days (not just Cuban). From what I can tell, if you're used to diverse, urban settings, you'll find Little Havana an interesting place to explore. If you're from the suburbs and assume that anyone who speaks Spanish is probably a criminal, you'll be beter off at the more controlled setting of the resorts at Orlando or South Beach. Overall we really enjoyed our short stay at Miami River Inn and will certainly consider staying again on our next visit to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Invigorating”
Reviews.Author: rocksteady60
Reviews.Content: This is a great alternative to staying at a busy, anonymous hotel. The property is lovely and well tended. The rooms are comfortable and affordable. I have stayed there the past two years. The staff is friendly and helpful. The property is near a large park where wonderful festivals and events are held. It has easy access to the highways, downtown and public transportation to get around. The hotel has a nice pool, breakfast room and grounds. They have private parking for your vehicle and the property is gated and locked. I felt safe at all times. One of the best things about the hotel is all of the friendly, international guests I've met. On my recent stay I met people from Japan, South America, Sweden and Israel as well as American guests from Orlando, Colorado, Texas and New York.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting, but think twice”
Reviews.Author: fineartlover
Reviews.Content: The Miami River Inn is located across the river from downtown. It is convenient if you are going to the Seybold building for business, but NOT on a cruise. The Inn bills itself as a Bed and Breakfast, but then informs you that 'breakfast" begins at 8:30AM, well after the time any business traveler would need to be served. No accomodations were made for business travelers (no coffee, cold rolls, no alarm clocks in the rooms.) The room was small, the matress was cheap and uncomfortable. The linens (bedspread) was old and pilled. The attendant was pleasant, but next time I will stay in a hotel. There are no restaurants close, no breakfast, and not even an alarm clock in the room. No one to give a wake up call. Definately NOT for the business traveler. You must park your car behind large iron gates (you are given a key). While I was told it was safe, I didn't feel so. It appears to be in a complex with apartments and not just Inn guests.

Reviews.Title: “Roaches in the Bathtub”
Reviews.Author: marcie76
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have ever been in. On our arrival, my friend and I noticed it looked nothing like the pictures online. The hotel is in fact in Little Havana!!! The guy at the desk was pleasant and showed us too our room. Once in our room we looked it over and realized that the shower was the hand held kind that fit into a holder on the wall. Only problem the holder on the wall was broken. The beds were dirty, there were cobwebs everywhere, and the room was so dusty it was hard to breathe. We asked to be moved to a different room. It was obvious that the man at the counter was very agitated with us, but he moved us to another room. This next room looked better, so we decided to just relax and watch TV. My friend went in to take a shower. A couple of seconds into getting ready for the shower, she says "what kind of bugs are these?" Now having recently lived in Florida, when someone says bug, you know what it is. But I went in and looked just to be sure, and yes it was. There were roaches in the bathtub. Now anyone who knows about roaches in the south, knows that the only ones you really have to worry about are the little ones that infest. Well that is what they were. Immediately we called another hotel, got a room reserved and then called a cab. The man at the desk refused to give us our money back, and insisted that the situation was ridiculous. I assured him that even having to have this conversation was, in fact, ridiculous and I was very disappointed in the service and accommodations. I handed him our key and explained that we had arranged other accommodations. He agreed that it was best if we left. I will never visit the Miami River Inn again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: SJCzar
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Miami River Inn for one night before leaving on a cruise. I would definitely recommend it and would love to go back again. After reading the mix of previous reviews, and considering how much lower the cost was to stay here, I wasn't sure what to expect. We were more than satisfied. We drove down from Fort Lauderdale and found it very easy to locate. Also appreciated the off-street locked parking lot. It's like being in your own little gated community within the big city when you stay at the Inn. The yard and pool area are very lovely. The hot tub is the hottest I think I've ever been in. We didn't get in until after 9:00pm and it was nice too still be able to use it as late as we wanted. I don't know if anyone else was in our house because I could not hear any noise during the night. Some people may prefer the sameness of chain hotels but we loved the homeiness of our room. The bathroom was very spacious and clean. All the staff and the other guests that were staying there were very friendly. Some of the other reviewers had concerns about the neighborhood. We went out for a walk around the area after 10:00pm and did not ever feel concerned about our safety. Granted, this was on a Friday night and there were so many other people out and about. It may be different on a weekday. I can't wait to go back again. Next time we'll stay for more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: webteach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Miami River Inn and we found it to be a lovely, peaceful oasis in the hubbub of Miami. The surroundings were lovely and the room was clean and cozy. We are experienced with bed and breakfast inns and this one was very nice. A wonderful cat greeted us and made us feel welcome ; Karen at the front desk was highly attentive and helpful to us. All in all a fine stay in a fine inn.

Reviews.Title: “Like Home”
Reviews.Author: benbenton
Reviews.Content: I wrote the following review last year and I stand by it. We stayed here again this year and we were just as satisfied as in years past. We have been returning to the Miami River Inn for so many years, we can't not remember exactly how many. Its the only place in Miami I would consider staying. The courtyard is sublime, the rooms are comfortable and clean, and Jane and Carlos take good care of us. We have brought friends with us on several occasions and they have also been satisfied. Some of the other reviews have described the neighborhood as dangerous and seedy. No city neighborhood is completely safe, but I do not feel particularly threatened in this one. If you are the type of person who likes the anonymous amenities of a large, modern hotel, this inn is not for you; but this little piece of old Miami is perfect for those of us who value historic properties.

Reviews.Title: “Creepy and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the website are nothing like what the Miami River Inn really looks like. This was our first time staying at a bed and breakfast and we were not impressed to say the least. Upon entering the room, the first thing we noticed were the dirty and stained pillows and bedspread. When we asked for more pillows and blankets, we were told they would see if they had any more available! The beds were like laying on concrete; I could barely make it down the stairs in the morning! Also, the website lists that they have internet access and since I needed it to complete research, I called to make sure they did. When we got there, I was told I had to go down to the pool to pick up a signal from another hotel in the area! There was no way I would sit out by the pool in a neighborhood like that even with the wrought iron fence surrounding the place! That's false advertising! The lady at the front desk was friendly and helpful when we asked about restaurants and other places in the area, but it did not make up for this dirty and creepy place.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been any worse...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Miami River Inn may truly be the only bed and breakfast in Miami, but that does NOT make it a nice place to stay. Upon arrival, I was quick to notice that the Inn is centrally located in the middle of the ghetto in downtown Miami. The entire Inn is enclosed with an ugly fence to keep out the "street people." Yes, the room rates may be tempting, but the accomodations are lacking and your surroundings could be dangerous. Do not believe what you see on the Inn's website. It looks nothing like the pictures. I cannot emphasize that enough. Take my advice, find a different place to stay--even if it requires additional money!

Reviews.Title: “Unique and Excelletnt”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the firs time and cannot say enough about it. Centrally located, great accommodations and setting, friendly and diligent staff. You feel like you are home. For a truly unique experience, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Difference”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying here. At first it threw me off because I was expecting something different, but after the first night it started to grow on me. I didn't spend much time in my room, so it's a great place to come back to after a long day of running around Miami; the breakfast was nice to me because it was homemade and light; and the area was in a neighborhood so you felt like you were coming home instead of coming back to a crowded hotel. I like the differences so much; I'm planning another trip in 2006.

Reviews.Title: “Gentile, Old-World Comfort”
Reviews.Author: woodstork
Reviews.Content: Chances are you've never stayed at a place quite like the Miami River Inn. It lies at the edge of Little Havana, directly across the river from downtown, yet is unbelievably quiet, secluded, friendly, personal and green. We were *very* fortunate to read Tripadvisor reviews and hit upon this place when we were looking for something low-cost but still having some character. And character is what the Miami River Inn has in gobs! The staff, especially the young woman clerk, I think would've done almost anything for us. Even with a good map, experience city driving and a sense of direction, I could NOT find this place from its address. I had to have the woman clerk stay with me on the phone until I drove into the parking lot. Then I had to call back to find out where the office was! Our room was small, the bed was only a double but good, and the bathroom was big enough to have a party in. The yard is to die for: well-established landscaping, green everywhere, a turquoise pool that did not look tempting in January, and lots of comfy outdoor furniture for breakfast, reading and general hanging out. Breakfast was marvelous coffee, teas, fruit breads, apples, bananas and oranges, yogurt, toast and spreads, cold cereal, all with antique tableware. The poor clerk again had to lead us to the part where breakfast was - although there are maybe 8? houses in the compound, only 4 are the hotel and others are private residences - and she did so graciously and smilingly. Lounging outdoors comes equipped with cats, which made us feel less lonely for ours. Indoors, the furnishings are all antiques. Our shower did have duct tape around the bathtub faucet, which may have been the only flaw in the whole place. There is a decanter of wine that lives inside the lobby and to which guests may help themselves, although, being sober, we didn't. The whole place is surrounded by a tall iron fence overgrown with greenery, and the compound felt very safe due to heavy gates that guests and residents need to use a key to get both into and out of. Next door there is a small cafe and grocery store at the base of the NeoLofts apartments. They sell pastries, coffee, good sub sandwiches, so-so pizzas. The elderly gentleman who runs it is Italian, raised in Argentina, and a great storyteller. His grandsons bustle around taking care of the clientele, many of whom are shopping or eating from the seemingly luxury apartments overhead, sometimes with their dogs to visit with and pat. The ever-so-helpful desk clerk also gave us a printed list of area restaurants with descriptions of the food they offer, how informal or formal they are, and prices to eat there. She recommended a place we saw but did not try, which produces fairly good Chinese, Italian and Mexican (?), all at the same place, which can also deliver. The lobby also includes a variety of pamphlets about area attractions. All in all, despite not necessarily having exquisite physical comforts, the Miami River Inn is wonderful in its history and warmth, and the staff made us feel extraordinarly welcomed. We would go back tomorrow if we could - certainly will hope to be back within the year.

Reviews.Title: “Not again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This quaint and friendly bed and breakfast would work well if you had a car. Our taxi rides to/from the airport and to/from Miami Beach cost us $100. The room was okay and the breafast was very diappointing. The location is not welcoming and not convienent. We would not stay here again
